question: A histopathologist is observing a skin biopsy specimen. He notices islands of basaloid cells and retraction artifacts in the slide. Which of the following tumors is the likely diagnosis?

A 36-year-old man presents with swollen, painful heels, nail changes, and left lower back pain that wakes him up from sleep. The back pain gets better with exercise. He reports 1 to 2 hours of morning stiffness. He also has a history of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis since he was 12 years old. It is decided to change his current regimen of indomethacin to a biologic that is a cluster of differentiation-2 (CD-2) receptor antagonist used in the treatment of psoriasis. Which of the following drugs is prescribed to him?

A 36-year-old male presents with swollen, painful heels, and left lower back pain that wakes him up from sleep. The back pain gets better with exercise. He reports 1 to 2 hours of morning stiffness. He also has a history of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis since he was 12 years old. It is decided to change his current regimen of indomethacin to a biologic that targets tumor necrosis factor (TNF-α). Which of the following is a chimeric monoclonal antibody that binds to TNF-α and inhibits its action?

A 60-year-old female comes to a primary health clinic. She complains of intense itching over her entire body, especially at night, for the last 1 week. On examination, she has a pimple-like rash on her wrists, armpits, abdomen, and buttocks. There are sores on the body caused by scratching. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An 8-year-old boy presents to the clinic with an extremely itchy rash for the past 2 days. He is the fourth student in his class to present with the same symptom. The rash is across his hands, wrists, and elbows bilaterally. Small erythematous papules with obvious burrows, looking like insect bites, aligned in 8 cm segments are seen on examination. What is the most appropriate treatment?
A patient presents with pigmentation under the nail and palpable axillary lymph nodes. Excision biopsy is indicated. What will be the differential diagnosis based on the clinical presentation?

A middle-aged farmer came to the clinic with a mass in the inner canthus of his eye. This mass was surgically removed and histologically diagnosed as basal cell carcinoma (BCC). Which of the following characteristics indicates a high-risk BCC?

answers.option: The tumor present on the trunk
Tumor with no recurrence before but now has recurrence

question: An 82-year-old man presented with a 1.2 x 0.7 cm nodular dichromic lesion on the scalp. The patient’s personal medical history was unremarkable. Which positive immune stain would confirm the diagnosis of invasive melanoma?
Phenylketonuria is a genetic disorder due to a deficiency of which of the following enzymes?

A 65-year-old male presents to the hospital with shortness of breath and cardiac illness. Which of the following antifungal agents should be avoided in patients with evidence of ventricular dysfunction?
Mutations in the genome could be most directly detected using which of the following?
Which of the following contributes to mitochondria in a progeny?
Which of the following is the number of genes in humans' mitochondrial genomes?
Gene-gene interactions are also dubbed as which of the following?
Spatial positioning of the chromosomes is determined by which of the following?
Pathogenic variants of the gene could be best retrieved from which of the following?
Which of the following is an example of a monogenic disorder?
DNA polymerase used in the amplification of DNA via PCR is isolated from which of the following?
Population-wise allele frequency could be obtained from which of the following?
What percentage of human nuclear DNA sequence is nearly identical between any two individuals?
Which term refers to the study of an organism's entire genetic makeup?
Which concept refers to the variation in the severity of a disorder in individuals who inherited the same disease allele?
What is the primary focus of medical genetics?

answers.option: The study of individual specific genes and thei role in inheritance
The study of entire genomes and how genes interact with the environment
The analysis of environmental factors on health
The development of novel cancer treatments
The study of gene therapy techniques

question: What is the primary focus of premarital counseling and carrier screening in high-risk populations?

answers.option: To identify and manage the risk of autosomal dominant disorders
To prevent marriage within the same tribe or caste
To encourage all individuals to marry outside their family
To calculate the recurrence risk of genetic disorders based on consanguinity
To promote awareness of genetic disorders and their implications

question: How should a healthcare provider counsel a consanguineous couple with a history of children affected by an autosomal recessive disorder and a desire to have another healthy child?

answers.option: Recommend immediate separation to prevent further health issues
Provide options for genetic testing and discuss potential reproductive choices
Advise them to avoid having more children altogether
Suggest adoption or the use of donor gametes as an alternative
Encourage them to continue without any genetic counseling

question: C>T6456 refers to which position is present in the wild-type population.
Which of the following is considered a negative consequence of consanguinity?

answers.option: Reduced genetic diversity within the population
Increased incidence of autosomal recessive disorders

question: How many genes are there approximately in the human genome?
Which term refers to the probability of a gene or trait being expressed?
What is the purpose of cascade screening in the context of genetic disorders?

answers.option: To test asymptomatic family members for a known genetic variant
To identify the affected gene in an individual
To screen for unrelated genetic disorders

question: Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB) is characterized by which of the following?
Which treatment is used for SMA that involves modifying SMN2 splicing?
Which type of inheritance pattern can be observed in Epidermolysis Bullosa?

answers.option: Both autosomal recessive and X-linked recessive

question: In beta thalassemia, the Bo allele typically results in which of the following?

answers.option: Complete absence of beta hemoglobin production

question: Which of the following genetic variants is a missense mutation?
The common mutations in the HBB gene causing beta-thalassemia in Pakistan include which of the following?
The homozygous pathogenic variants for the Bo allele (Bo/Bo) in beta-thalassemia typically result in which of the following?

answers.option: Complete absence of alpha globin chain

question: The term β thalassemia intermedia is used to describe individuals with which of the following genotypes?
What is precision medicine?

answers.option: Medical interventions that are same for all patients
Medical interventions that ignore individual patient characteristics
Medical interventions that are geared towards the characteristics of each individual patients
Medical interventions that are based on general population statistics
Medical interventions that only focus on genetic disorders

question: What is the approximate cost of the gene therapy drug Zolgensma?
What is a significant ethical concern related to gene-based therapies?

answers.option: The manufacturing process of the therapies
The ease of administration of the therapies
The availability of trained medical staff

question: Which of the following is an example of a genetic disorder treated with splice-switching oligonucleotides (SSO)?
Which of the following is NOT listed as a clinical application of current and future gene-based therapies?
In human blood type inheritance, what is an example of co-dominance?
Which gene-based therapy involves modifying the expression of genes using synthetic RNA molecules?
Which of the following best describes the inheritance pattern of incomplete dominance?

answers.option: Only recessive allele expresses its phenotype
The phenotype of the heterozygote is an intermediate between the two homozygotes
Both alleles express their phenotypes independently
The recessive allele expresses its phenotypes only in the absence of the dominant allele
The dominant allele always masks the recessive allele

question: How does cancer genomics contribute to the precision medicine?

answers.option: By analyzing the environmental factors contributing to cancer development
By studying the psychological impact of cancer diagnosis
By focusing in population level cancer prevention strategies
By identifying specific genetic mutations that can be targeted with tailored therapies

question: A chromosomal translocation involving chromosomes 9 and 22 occurs in certain diseases. Which of the following diseases incur the above translocation?
Which of the following terms refers to the phenomenon where a single gene mutation leads to multiple effects on an individual's phenotype?
How to identify X-linked recessive Mendelian disorders?

answers.option: They are always lethal in males
They affect males more severely than females
They skip generation due to X inactivation

question: Which of the following is the inheritance pattern of the autosomal dominant Mendelian disorders?

answers.option: Only one copy of the mutated allele is sufficient to cause the disorder
The disorder is passed from father to son only
Both parents must be affected for the offspring to inherit the disorder
The disorder is passed from mother to daughter only

question: Which of the following is the anomaly type where a piece of one chromosome breaks off and becomes attached to another non-homologous chromosome?
A junior student comes to you and asks about the difference between phenotype, genotype, and haplotype. Which of the following definitions/features will you tell him for genotype?

answers.option: At two different loci of two non homologous chromosomes
At a locus consists of both of the allele occupying that locus on the two non-homologous chromosomes
At a locus consists of neighboring alleles occupying single and same chromosome
At a locus consists of both of the allele occupying that locus on the two homologous chromosomes
At a locus consists of both of the alleles occupying different locus on the two homologous chromosomes

question: which of the following distinguishes germline mutations from somatic mutations in the context of genetic disorders?

answers.option: Germline mutations are inherited and present in every cell of an individual's body, while somatic mutations are not inherited and occur only in specific cells
Germline mutations are acquired during an individual's lifetime, while somatic mutations are present at birth
Germline mutation are typically caused by environmental factors, while somatic mutations are primarily genetic in origin
Germline mutations occur in non-reproductive cells, while somatic mutations occur in reproductive cells

question: A 4-month-old male with a history of recurrent fever, respiratory infections, and axial hypotonia is diagnosed with spinal muscle atrophy (SMA). What genetic testing method is typically used to diagnose SMA?
In the case of neonatal hemophilia, which of the following coagulation study results is the most consistent with the diagnosis?
Which of the following is a possible complication later in life for a child diagnosed with Down syndrome?

A 39-year-old female is diagnosed with high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma and a family history of breast cancer in a paternal aunt is found to have a germline BRCA1 mutation. What are the recommended follow-up actions for her?

answers.option: Breast screening and risk-reducing removal of tubes and ovaries from age 40
Radiation therapy as the primary treatment

question: How does knowing a patient's family history contribute to the diagnosis and management of genetic disorders?

answers.option: It allows for cosmetic procedures to correct physical abnormalities
It provides insights into the mode of inheritance and recurrence risk of the disorder
It helps determine the patient's favorite foods for dietary recommendations
It helps identify potential environmental factors contributing to the disorder
It allows for personalized treatment plans based on the patient's hobbies

question: Sports medicine is a branch of medicine that deals with physical fitness, treatment, and prevention of injuries related to sports and exercise. Specific treatment programs for sportspersons are important, considering the scope of nutrition for sportspeople. To cover the optimal nutritional requirements, the caloric intake should be according to which of the following?

In sports medicine, what is the type of physical training that is designed to improve specific motor abilities such as strength, endurance, speed, agility, and flexibility tailored to enhance overall performance and fitness levels?

Which of the following is known as the general capacity to adapt and respond favorably to physical effort, depending on the individual's state of health, body constitution, and present and previous physical activity?

An elderly patient living near the equator, a farmer by profession had a previous burn over his trunk 15 years ago. Now for 1 month, this burn scar has turned into a raised lesion along with ulceration, itching, and some mild discharge. On histopathology, it was diagnosed as Marjolin's ulcer. What is the best option regarding excisional margin?

answers.option: >2 cm lesion needed clearance of 1 mm margin
Squamous cell carcinoma can be dealt with radiotherapy until patient has recurrence
>2 cm lesion needed clearance of 1 cm margin
<2 cm lesion needed clearance of 2 mm margin
Both <2cm lesion needed clearance of 2 mm margin and >2 cm lesion needed clearance of 1 cm margin are correct

question: Sea diving is a high-risk activity with a death rate of 0.4 per 1000 participants. More than 25% of deaths occur in young male divers. Loss of consciousness accounts for the greatest number of deaths and is usually attributed to which of the following?

A 30-year-old man, who works at a restaurant, is brought by his coworkers to the hospital with burn injuries on both legs after getting in contact with boiling water. The affected area is blistered with clear fluid and the area is painful. According to the classification for burns, which degree burn is this?
Which of the following is an indication that a recovering patient with a burn injury after treatment is out of danger and at a low risk of infection?

An effective burn prevention plan should be multi-sectoral and include broad efforts to improve awareness and develop and enforce effective policy. For this purpose, what is the first and most important step?

answers.option: Set research priorities with promotion of promising interventions
Improve burn care facilities in hospitals
Describe burden and identify risk factors

question: A man visited a primary healthcare center with complaints of pimple-like rash between fingers, on wrist, elbows, armpits, and navel. He complained of intense itching, especially at night. There were sores on the body caused by scratching. Which one of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient's condition?

A sudden explosion happens in a busy marketplace, after which rescue workers start assessing the injured and tagging them with different color codes. Which of the following term best describes this action?
The four principal components in managing humanitarian supplies are acquisition, transportation, storage, and distribution. These happen during which phase of disaster management?

Louse-borne relapsing fever epidemic appears from time to time in districts of Pakistan adjoining Afghanistan, particularly when nomads migrate during winter. Louse does not transmit infection through bite or feces but the organism gains access through infected fluid liberated when the victim crushes the louse or scratches the area where the louse is feeding. Which one of the following is the most appropriate prevention for this infection?
A building collapsed even before the completion of the project, many workers were severely injured. What are the efforts aimed at treating and rehabilitating the victims referred as?

In developing countries morbidity and mortality due to accidents are rising. According to the observations made by the Karachi Development Authority, which of the following is the most affected in city accidents?
Ivermectin is indicated in the treatment of which of the following skin infections?

An 8-year-old male child presented with an itchy rash over the body for the last 2 weeks. On examination, there are multiple papules over the finger webs and genitals, excoriation marks were also present over the limbs and trunks and a few linear raised lesions were present between the toes. On further details, his mother said her other child was also complaining of itch and their sleep is disturbed due to itching. What is the characteristic lesion of this condition?

An elderly homeless male has had a rash all over his body for two months. On examination, crusted, hyperkeratotic lesions were present mainly over the palms and soles. There is scaling and erythema all over the body, and the nails are also thickened and rough. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy presented with severe itching over the scalp for the last month. Itching was throughout the day. It was not associated with any change in shampoos. On examination, there are multiple small whitish structures seen over the occipital area, and the hair shaft is more pronounced on the occipital and parietal areas. What is the likely diagnosis?

A five-year-old boy presented with a few circular patches of hair loss over the scalp covered with fine grey scales for the last 2 months. It was associated with mild itching. Wood's lamp examination showed green fluorescent. There was no history of fever or lymphadenopathy. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 2-year-old baby presented with itching all over the body for a few months. On examination, she had generalized dry skin and there were erythematous plaques of excoriation, hyperkeratosis over the cheeks, cubital fossa, and popliteal fossa. There is a positive history of asthma and allergic rhinitis in the family. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 20-year-old male presented with itching over the scalp and dryness of the face for the last 6 weeks. He has similar episodes, especially in winter. On examination of the scalp and face, there were greasy yellowish scales, and the back of the ear, nasolabial fold, and eyebrows had erythematous patches with fine scales. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 37-year-old man complained of anorexia, nausea, enlargement of his breast, and fatigue. The man, recently diagnosed with pulmonary coccidioidomycosis, has been receiving an antifungal treatment for two weeks. Which of the following drugs most likely caused these adverse effects?

A 20-year-old resident from Gadap Town Karachi visited a hospital for complaints of weight loss, irritation, and white bands on fingernails. He is a farmer who used to drink well water. There is no history of addiction. Chronic poisoning from which of the following is most likely to be present in this patient?

A young medical student has developed foul-smelling breath for the last few weeks. He noticed a bluish line on the gums of the upper jaw and a loss of appetite. Red marks on the back are also present. Poisoning from which of the following is most likely in this patient?
All of the following are the advantages of silicone implants except:
Which of the following is not an example of a local flap?

An 87-year-old man presents with erythema and blistering of his chest and upper extremities. Examination shows tense bullae on an erythematous base. A skin biopsy reveals subepidermal blisters with inflammatory infiltrate with numerous eosinophils. Which of the following is true for the direct immunofluorescence findings regarding the diagnosis?

answers.option: Deposition of IgG and C3 in a linear fashion along the dermal basement membrane
Deposition of IgA at the dermo-epidermal junction
Deposition of IgG and C3 in a fishnet pattern
Deposition of IgG and C1q around the hair follicles
Deposition of IgM and fibrin around dermal blood vessels

question: Which of the following best corresponds to the histopathological features of pemphigus vulgaris?

answers.option: Intraepidermal acantholysis with chicken wire pattern IgG on direct immunofluorescence
Acantholytic dyskeratotic cells and parakeratotic columns with negative direct immunofluorescence
Focal acantholysis with a various pattern and negative direct immunofluorescence
Dilapidated brick wall appearance with negative direct immunofluorescence

question: In which of the following are transposition flaps very useful?
The first instrument built specifically for skin graft harvesting was developed by?
A graft is applied to an approximately >10 cm burn wound area. Which of the following grafts has more primary contraction?
A 20-year-old boy applies a skin graft over a wound, which heals in four phases. Which of the following is NOT one of these phases?
Why is there a need for a mesh graft in a 15% burn patient?

answers.option: Increases the area of the graft
Uniform distribution of the graft as a source of spread epidermis

question: A 55-year-old obese female, with a known case of diabetes mellitus, presented with an itchy rash over the chest and lower abdomen for 2 weeks. On examination, ill-defined erythematous beefy patches with multiple small satellite lesions over the sub-mammary area, lower abdomen, and inguinal region. What is the likely diagnosis?

A school-going girl presented with severe itching over the scalp for several days. On examination, she has few papules, pustules, and excoriation on the scalp along with cervical lymphadenopathy. Hair shows nits (empty eggs) of insects. What is the likely diagnosis?
Wickham’s striae refer to:

answers.option: Stretch marks due to topical potent steroids
Thin white line in lichen planus
White spots on buccal mucosa opposite to the 2nd premolar tooth

question: A young female presented with an extremely itchy rash over her limbs for the past 20 days. On examination, purplish papules with flat tops were present over the volar aspect of the wrist and extensor surfaces of arms and legs. Few papules were also erythematous. There was no scaling. Itching was present throughout the day with a negative family history. What is the diagnosis?

A young patient presented to dermatology OPD with multiple small white spots on the upper body with slight scaling. It was associated with mild itching. He was diagnosed as a case of tinea versicolor. He was prescribed oral antifungals. What is the primary lesion in this scenario?

A 48-year-old female presented with thickened, discolored nails associated with pain for the last 2 months. On examination, there were onycholysis, subungual hyperkeratosis, and ridging in five nails of both hands associated with paronychia. What is the likely diagnosis?

A patient came to the outpatient department with pigmentation on the face for three months. On close examination, she has hyperpigmented patches on the face with hypopigmented margins. What is the diagnosis?

A 30-year-old nursing staff member presented to the dermatology outpatient department with a complaint of a rash on both hands for the past 3 to 4 months. On examination, the hands were dry, cracked, and hyperkeratotic with an erythematous background, involving the dorsal and palmar surface of the hands extending up to the wrist. The patient also noticed some improvement when she was on vacation. What is the first-line management in this patient?
